DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that asks whether the patient is receiving enzyme-inducing anticonvulsant medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the medication received by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A drug or substance that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving enzyme i
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving enzyme inducing anticonvulsants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants including phenytoin, phenobarbital, or carbamazepine within 7 days prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is taking enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants (i.e., carbamazepine, fosphenytoin, oxcarbazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin, primidone), has patient accepted the option for Arm 1 (durvalumab monotherapy) and or Arm 2 (durvalumab + gemcitabine)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has been receiving enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants, have they been off of them for less than 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive enzyme-inducing anticonvulsants including phenytoin, phenobarbital, valproic acid, or carbamazepine within 7 days prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving moderate or strong CYP3A4/5 enzyme inducing anticonvulsants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is on anti-seizure medications, are they being enrolled at the discretion of the Principal Investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient taking enzyme inducing anticonvulsants?
